definition: Dear Sirs/To Whom It May Concern
to respect/to venerate/to salute/to offer
variant of 啟|启[qi3]
to open/to start/to initiate/to enlighten or awaken/to state/to inform
variant of 啟|启[qi3]
Qi son of Yu the Great 禹[Yu3], reported founder of the Xia Dynasty 夏朝[Xia4 Chao2] (c. 2070-c. 1600 BC)

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Dear Sir/Madam, I am doing a school project about food.
sentences.chinese: 敬启者，我正在做一个关于食品的学校课题。

definition: to respectfully inform (used at the beginning or end of letters)
respectful closing to a letter
(honorific) revered news/the most valuable information (in your recent letter, book etc)/Thank you for your letter.
respectfully yours (in closing a letter)
(used at the end of a letter to introduce a polite salutation)
to present respectfully/with (sb's) compliments/complimentary
would like to invite (epistolary style)
please answer (epistolary style)
to lie prostrate/to prostrate oneself (in veneration)
respectfully yours (at the end of a letter)
epistolary formula used at the head of a letter
(honorific) your father
to offer humbly (written at the end of letter from sb of lower status to higher status)/your humble servant
postscript
honorific term for one's deceased father/(arch.) great-great-grandfather
inscription with name, date, or short sentence, on a painting, gift, letter etc
